net.openhft.chronicle.core.threads

Interface EventLoop

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, QueryCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    OnDemandEventLoop

    public interface EventLoop
extends Closeable

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean DEBUG_ADDING_HANDLERS

      • Methods inherited from interface net.openhft.chronicle.core.io.Closeable

    • Field Detail

      • DEBUG_ADDING_HANDLERS

        static final boolean DEBUG_ADDING_HANDLERS

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name()

      • addHandler

        void addHandler(EventHandler handler)
        Add handler to event loop to be executed. Event loops should execute handlers in order of priority. Handlers with same priority have no guarantee of execution order. Handlers will not be executed before start() has been called.
        Parameters:
        handler - handler

      • start

        void start()
        Start the event loop

      • unpause

        void unpause()
        Typical implementation will unpause the event loop's Pauser

      • stop

        void stop()
        Notify event loop to stop executing handlers. It is not expected that event loops can then be restarted

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface QueryCloseable
        Returns:
        true close has been called

      • isAlive

        boolean isAlive()
        Returns:
        true if the main thread is running

      • awaitTermination

        void awaitTermination()
        Wait until the event loop has terminated (after close has been called)
